title: How to know a bush is warded...?
body:
Just something I've learned over the months as a support:
If you are ranged, have auto attack ON, if you stand in a bush, you will attack nearby minions if it is warded.

Dunno if this is common sense in the community, but I still see some who just keep aaing while inside the brush, acting totally stealthy and...stuff.

CLARITY (I told myself to edit, and I did! whee)

Not minion aggro which doesn't work when the waves meet.

Your attack animation will still proc if an enemy can see you via ward/invis. Your projectile when ranged will usually go to a nearby minion, which gives you enough info to back off.

replies.body:
This only works in bot lane or top if you have one of the few top ranged champs. Otherwise there are no minions are to attack. So, the bushes in the jungle or the two bushes in the river beside mid lane don't apply. 
It works for the supports, during laning phase if the enemy minion wave is in the right place, and you have enough time to stand still and see if your champ attacks the minion wave; but it's too situational to be of use 99.9% of the time.

Happens to me more than you might think, maybe I'm playing wrong or something o.O

Just thought it was a neat little trick though :3

I know this is known by everyone, but what I was suggesting was not the minion aggro, but your champ aggro. Just read it carefully.
Used to use this all the time, I turned off the auto attack since it got annoying when trying to cs, I usually just aggro a minion to me before going into the brush now.

CLARITY (because I'm too lazy to edit)

Not minion aggro which doesn't work when the waves meet.

Your attack animation will still proc if an enemy can see you via ward/invis. Your projectile when ranged will usually go to a nearby minion, which gives you enough info to back off.

Easiest way for me, during laning at least, is to just see if minions aggro me in a bush. If they do, warded, if not, not warded. Minions obey every LoS rules that champions do, with the exception of 'selfish' LoS like Rek'Sai W and Rengar ult.

I pretty much use the same method, especially as a support and am not sure if the opposition has warded or not.

It is easy enough to walk through the bush or wait there and if the minions aggro you then you know there is a ward there, get the sweeper out if you have it and kill the ward.

generally speaking though if the support has a sightstone then there is a pretty good chance the bushes will be constantly warded until a tower goes down and well if you have a teemo in the bot lane expect shrooms there after he hits level 6
Yeah, I use this when I'm melee, but it's harder to execute when the enemies don't let you get close to the minions. ^^
